member.name: T:Infragistics.Excel.BIFF8Writer
member.summary: BIFF8Writer provides static methods for exporting abstract workbook object to concrete Excel file.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Excel.BIFF8Writer.WriteWorkbookToFile(Infragistics.Excel.Workbook,System.String)
member.summary: Writes existing workbook object to a file in BIFF8 format.
member.param: Workbook to export.
Filename of resulting excel file. If path is not included, file is created in default program folder.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Excel.BIFF8Writer.WriteWorkbookToStream(Infragistics.Excel.Workbook,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Writes existing workbook object to a stream.
member.param: Workbook to export.
Output file stream.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Excel.BIFF8Writer.WriteWorkbookToStreamEx(Infragistics.Excel.Workbook,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Writes existing workbook object to a stream in BIFF8 format.
member.param: Workbook to export.
An output stream to generate the BIFF8 content into.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Excel.BIFF8Writer.WriteWorksheet(Infragistics.Excel.BIFF8Writer.TemporaryWriterData,Infragistics.Excel.Worksheet,Infragistics.Excel.BIFFRecordset)
member.summary: Writes a Worksheet section.
member.param: A sink into which data is written.
The Worksheet instance to serialize out.
A record set.

remarks.p: Before calling this method, you must have called . The caller is responsible for writing a BOF before and an EOF after each serialized. One or more Worksheet substreams may follow the Workbook Globals section of the BIFF8 file.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Excel.BIFF8Writer.WriteWorkbookGlobals(Infragistics.Excel.BIFF8Writer.TemporaryWriterData)
member.summary: Writes the Workbook Globals section.
member.param: A sink into which data is written.

remarks.p: The Workbook Globals substream appears once at the beginning of the file stream specifying information applicable to all Worksheets. The order in which BIFF records appear in substreams is important. This globals substream is then followed by one or more Worksheet substreams.
The Workbook and MainBIFFStream properties of TemporaryWriterData must have already been pre-initialized before a call is made to this method.
The caller of this method is responsible for writing the initial BOF and trailing EOF for this substream.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Excel.BIFF8Writer.DefaultFonts(Infragistics.Excel.BIFF8Writer.TemporaryWriterData,Infragistics.Excel.BIFFRecordset)
member.summary: Bulk copies default fonts into Workbook stream.
member.param: A writer context used to initialize the set of default Fonts.
A BIFF record set into which these currency formats are stored.

remarks.p: Unless the collection has been modified, the default FONT records are set to Arial, 10pt, Black, Regular by ResolvedFontData.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Excel.BIFF8Writer.DefaultFormats(Infragistics.Excel.BIFFRecordset)
member.summary: Bulk copies default currency formats into Workbook stream.
member.param: A BIFF record set into which these currency formats are stored.

remarks.p: Excel normally generates these on the client based on the client locale when saving a file. These default currency records are hardcoded to use the US Dollar ($), with the exception of #41 through #44 which support a blind currency symbol provided it appears after the currency value (for instance, the Euro and Yen in some locales).

member.name: M:Infragistics.Excel.BIFF8Writer.DefaultExtendedFormats(Infragistics.Excel.BIFFRecordset)
member.summary: Bulk copies default extended formats into Workbook stream.
member.param: A BIFF record set into which these XF records are stored.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Excel.BIFF8Writer.DefaultStyles(Infragistics.Excel.BIFFRecordset)
member.summary: Bulk copies default built-in styles into Workbook stream.
member.param: A BIFF record set into which built-in styles are stored.

remarks.p: The STYLE records injected by this method into the Workbook stream are of the abbreviated, built-in type. Variable-length, user-defined styles are not injected by this method.

Options regarding the visibility of the Workbook window, scroll and tab bars.
Index of the currently active Worksheet (zero-based).
Index of the first visible tab in the Worksheet tab bar (zero-based). This value should be -1 when wndwFlags does not include .

member.name: T:Infragistics.Excel.WINDOW2.OptionsEnum
member.summary: Worksheet option flags.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.WINDOW2.OptionsEnum.DspFmla
member.summary: Display formulas (default is display calculation results).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.WINDOW2.OptionsEnum.DspGrid
member.summary: Display grid lines (default is grid lines hidden).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.WINDOW2.OptionsEnum.DspRwCol
member.summary: Display worksheet headings (default is worksheet headings hidden).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.WINDOW2.OptionsEnum.Frozen
member.summary: Freeze panes (default is panes are not frozen).

remarks.p: Use of this flag requires that there exist one or more subsequent PANE records in the Worksheet stream. The PANE record is not supported in the current implementation.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.WINDOW2.OptionsEnum.DspZeros
member.summary: Display zero as values (default is display zero as an empty cell).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.WINDOW2.OptionsEnum.AutoGridColors
member.summary: Automatic grid line colors (default is manual grid line colors).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.WINDOW2.OptionsEnum.RightToLeft
member.summary: Columns from right-to-left (default is left-to-right).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.WINDOW2.OptionsEnum.DspOutlines
member.summary: Display outline symbols (default is outline symbols hidden).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.WINDOW2.OptionsEnum.DefrostNoSplit
member.summary: Remove splitter bars when pane no longer frozen (default is to retain splitter bars).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.WINDOW2.OptionsEnum.Selected
member.summary: Worksheet is selected (default is not selected).

remarks.p: The number of Worksheets with this flag set must match the corresponding value of selectedSheets in the corresponding record of the Workbook.
This flag is not compatible with BIFF4 (BIFF4W) and earlier formats.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.WINDOW2.OptionsEnum.Visible
member.summary: Display Worksheet (default is Worksheet hidden).

remarks.p: This flag is not compatible with BIFF4 (BIFF4W) and earlier formats.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.WINDOW2.OptionsEnum.Paged
member.summary: Display Worksheet in Page Break Preview (default is display Worksheet in Normal View).

remarks.p: This flag is not compatible with BIFF7 and earlier formats.

remarks.p: The settings of this record are maintained as a collection of bit flags.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Excel.WSBOOL.#ctor(Infragistics.Excel.WSBOOL.Options)
member.summary: Creates a WSBOOL record compatible with BIFF8.
member.param: Flags describing the options applicable to worksheets in the end user's workspace.

remarks.p: The record created does not support the BIFF4 capability of specifying the workspace's windowing arrangement. In later BIFF formats, see and instead.

The record created does not support the BIFF3 and BIFF4 capacity for storing a flag describing how external links are serialized, this capability is supported instead by BOOKBOOL on the Workbook level by later BIFF formats.

member.summary: Display the worksheet as a dialog (default is to display as a spreadsheet).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.WSBOOL.Options.ApplyStyles

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.WSBOOL.Options.ColGroupLeft

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.WSBOOL.Options.FitToPage

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.WSBOOL.Options.DspGuts

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.WSBOOL.Options.AlternateExpEval

member.name: T:Infragistics.Excel.IWorksheetCellFormat
member.summary: Cell formatting interface.

remarks.p: Provides interface to cell specific formatting (font, number format, appearance etc.). Cell formatting can be associated with specific cell, row or column in a Worksheet. If cell format property has default value, value of previous object in resolution chain is used. Resolution priority is: CELL (top priority), ROW, COLUMN, DEFAULT CELL FORMAT (lowest priority). For example, if row cell format background color is blue and column cell format background color is set to red, cell with default background color (Color.Empty) and positioned in that row and column will have blue color in exported file (as row has higher priority than column). Resolution process is done internally during exporting process, which means that cell format background color is always default if not explicitly set.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Excel.IWorkbookFont
member.summary: Font formatting interface.

remarks.p: Provides interface to font formatting. If some font property has default value, value of previous object in resolution chain is used. Resolution priority is: CELL (top priority), ROW, COLUMN, DEFAULT FONT FORMAT (lowest priority). For example, if column font is set to blue and bold and row font is set to italic and not bold, resulting text at intersection of row and column will be italic and blue but not bold (because row font settings have higher priority than column font settings). Resolution process is done internally during exporting process, which means that some font property always has a default value if it is not explicitly set.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Excel.Header
member.summary: Header block in OLE2 Structured Storage.

remarks.p: The Header block is written out to the first big block in any OLE2 Structured Storage file system. It is not actually a big block, though, since Big Block #0 gets serialized immediately after it (the Header block could therefore be thought of existing at index -1, from this perspective.)

This block contains information on where the block allocation table is, its size, information about alternate block allocation tables (the small BAT and xtra BAT, both unsupported in this implementation and only needed for very small files less than 64 bytes long or for very large files several gigabytes long), and information about the location of the property table.

Calling the method on this class serializes out the HEADER and BAT_BLOCK records for an OLE2 Structured Storage device. Prior to calling this method, the client is responsible for assigning a value to the propertyCount field.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Excel.Header.CalculateFileBlocks(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the number of big blocks required to hold the file.
member.param: The size in bytes of the file.
member.returns: The number of big blocks required to hold the file.

remarks.p: When the file is not evenly divisible by the blockSize, the remainder of the file populates one additional big block allocated to handle overflow. The actualSize of the file then must be set on the accompanying Property.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Excel.Header.CalculatePropertyBlocks(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the number of big blocks required to hold the Property Table.
member.param: The size in bytes of one big block.
member.returns: The number of big blocks required to hold the Property Table.

remarks.p: When the property table is not evenly divisible by four, the remaining propertly blocks necessitate one additional big block be allocated to holding the Property Table.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Excel.Header.CalculateBATBlocks(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the number of blocks consumed by the Block Allocation Table (BAT).
member.param: The size of a block in bytes.
member.returns: Number of blockSize-byte blocks consumed by the BAT.

remarks.p: The AddFile method needs the number of blocks consumed by the BAT to calculate an offset to the starting block index of a newly created File.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Excel.Header.Write(System.IO.BinaryWriter)
member.summary: Writes the HEADER and BAT_BLOCK for the OLE2 Structured Storage.
member.param: A binary writer stream to deposit the binary data into.

remarks.p: This method does not yet support writing multiple BAT_BLOCK records.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Excel.PropertyTable
member.summary: Property Table block in OLE2 Structured Storage.

remarks.p: The Property Table block is written out to the ending big blocks in this OLE2 Structured Storage file system implementation, and these blocks are marked as ''special'' in the BAT. Each Big Block dedicated to the storage of the Property Table holds approximately four 128-byte records. The Property Table comprises the hierarchical directory structure of individual documents and folders within the Structured Storage system.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Excel.PropertyTable.AddProperty(System.String,Infragistics.Excel.PropertyType,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a Property to the Property Table.
member.param: The name of the Document or Folder.
The type of Property to write.
The home Folder of the Document or Folder added.
The starting block where the Document's data is serialized.
The actual size (in bytes) of the Document's data, if not evenly divisible by 512.
member.returns: The ID number assigned to the newly added Property within the table.

remarks.p: This method is invoked by the to create a Document (or Folder).
The caller often requires the id assigned to the by the PropertyTable for subsequent processing (such as storing this index into the Block Allocation Table, or BAT.)

member.name: M:Infragistics.Excel.PropertyTable.Write(System.IO.BinaryWriter)
member.summary: Writes the PROPERTYTAB blocks for the OLE2 Structured Storage.
member.param: A BinaryWriter to which property table data is to be serialized.

remarks.p: The serialization is largely delegated to the Write method of the contained instances. It pads out the big block written to the sink to make it evenly divisible by 512 bytes.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Excel.PropertyType
member.summary: Property type classifications.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.PropertyType.RootEntry
member.summary: This Property is the root entry in the hierarchical tree.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.PropertyType.File
member.summary: This Property is a leaf entry in the hierarchical tree.

remarks.p: Properties of type File may have siblings but must not have children.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.PropertyType.Directory
member.summary: This Property is a branch entry in the hierarchical tree.

remarks.p: A directory may or may not be empty. If it is empty, then it is called a dead branch.
In addition to having children, directories may have siblings that are either File or Directory properties.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Excel.NodeType
member.summary: Color classification of a Property.

remarks.p: OLE2 Structured Storage is formally designed to behave as a red-black tree data structure for self-balancing purposes. This implementation does not support Red node functionality.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.NodeType.Red
member.summary: The property is Red.

remarks.p: No two adjacent properties may both be Red.
The current implementation never sets properties to Red.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.NodeType.Black
member.summary: The property is Black.

remarks.p: The RootEntry is always Black.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Excel.Property
member.summary: Property records in OLE2 Structured Storage.

remarks.p: The Property records appear, one per Folder or Document in Structured Storage, in the as 128-byte long records. Each property maintains information about its name, the length of its name, an assortment of timestamps, the block index where its document's storage begins, and its relationship to one or more sibling and child properties in the hierarchical property table.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Excel.Property.Write(System.IO.BinaryWriter)
member.summary: Writes the PROPERTY records within the PROPERTYTAB blocks of OLE2 Structured Storage.
member.param: A BinaryWriter to which property record data is to be serialized.

remarks.p: This method is called by the Write method of . It is not generally advisable to call this outside of the context of the PropertyTable's serialization.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Excel.PseudoFileSystem
member.summary: Encapsulates the underlying storage devices of OLE2 Structured Storage in a file system metaphor.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Excel.PseudoFileSystem.PreWrite(System.IO.BinaryWriter)
member.summary: Writes out the beginning of the OLE2-compatible Structured Storage stream.
member.param: A BinaryWriter into which to deposit the header and allocation table of the Structured Storage stream.

remarks.p: The caller should then serialize any streams s/he has a hold of in ascending order of their property ID's (that the caller retained when calling .)

member.name: M:Infragistics.Excel.PseudoFileSystem.PostWrite(System.IO.BinaryWriter)
member.summary: Writes out the ending of the OLE2-compatible Structured Storage stream.
member.param: A BinaryWriter into which to deposit the properties table of the Structured Storage stream.

remarks.p: This method automatically flushes the output stream, yet the caller may still wish to call Close on it separately to recollect it's underlying handle and system resources.

member.summary: Abstract base class common to all OLE2-compatible Structured Storage implementations.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Excel.OLE2StructuredStorage.ExportStreamFromFile(System.String,System.String,System.Byte[]@)

member.param: The file name representing the Structured Storage file system.
The stream name of a document contained within the Structured Storage file system.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Excel.OLE2StructuredStorage.GetImplementation(Infragistics.Excel.OLE2StructuredStorage.StorageProviderType)
member.summary: Factory method to retrieve any appropriate OLE2-compatible Structured Storage Provider.
member.param: The type of provider to retrieve (OLE2 or Managed).
member.returns: An instance of a subclass that provides the required services, or null (Nothing in Visual Basic) when no such instance could be created.

remarks.p: An object that may safely be typecast to when an OLE2 Structured Storage Provider was requested, or alternately a instance when a Managed Structured Storage Provider is requested.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Excel.Workbook
member.summary: Abstract representation of Microsoft Excel workbook.

remarks.p: Represents Microsoft Excel workbook. Workbook itself doesnt have any methods for writing its contents to binary or XLM files or streams. Use provided writer classes instead.
Every workbook consists of one or more worksheets (). Default constructor creates empty workbook.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.Workbook.MaxExcelRowCount
member.summary: Maximum number of rows in the worksheet allowed by Excel.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.Workbook.MaxExcelColumnCount
member.summary: Maximum number of columns in the worksheet allowed by Excel.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.Workbook.MaxExcelColorCount
member.summary: Maximum number of colors in the workbook allowed by Excel.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Excel.Workbook.MaxExcelCellFormatCount
member.summary: Maximum number of distinct cell formats in the workbook allowed by Excel.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Excel.Workbook.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor.

remarks.p: Creates empty workbook.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Excel.Workbook.CreateNewWorksheetCellFormat
member.summary: Creates new worksheet cell format.

remarks.p:
descibes cell specific formatting (font, number format, appearance etc.). Total number of different cell formats in excel workbook is limited to . If many parts of excel workbook have same and complex (more than one property incommon) cell formatting, use this method in following manner:
Create new cell format with ,
Set all neccessary properties on given cell format,
Apply cell format to all excel objects which use it with method.

Use of this procedure will simplify you code for complex cell formats and increase speed of resulting program. It will not reduce total number of cell formats in a workbook as cell formats are internally cached no mather which method is used.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Excel.Workbook.CreateNewWorkbookFont
member.summary: Creates new workbook font.

remarks.p:
descibes font used in excel workbook. If many parts of excel workbook have same and complex (more than one property incommon) font formatting, use this method in following manner:
Create new font format with ,
Set all neccessary properties on given font format,
Apply font format to all excel objects which use it with method.

Use of this procedure will simplify you code for complex font formats and increase speed of resulting program. It will not reduce total number of font formats in a workbook as font formats are internally cached no mather which method is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Excel.Workbook.Styles
member.summary: Collection of workbook styles.

remarks.p: Use this collection to add custom styles to excel workbook. User can apply that styles to different parts of excel workbook and thereby set complex formattings with ease.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Excel.Workbook.Worksheets
member.summary: Worksheets in the workbook.

remarks.p: Number of worksheets in a workbook is not limited. Use to set active worksheet. Active worksheet is the one which is active upon opening of excel file.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Excel.Workbook.ActiveWorksheet
member.summary: Reference to active worksheet.

remarks.p: Active worksheet is the one which is active upon opening of excel file. When first worksheet is added to an empty workbook, it is automatically set to be active worksheet.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Excel.Workbook.Protected
member.summary: Protection state of Excel workbook.

remarks.p: Prevents changes to worksheet and to locked cells.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Excel.Workbook.DefaultFontHeight
member.summary: Default font height, in units of 1/20th of a point.

remarks.p: Use this property to set resolved font height for created fonts which don't have height explicitly set. Unit of measure is twips (1/20th of a point).

member.name: T:Infragistics.Excel.Worksheet
member.summary: Represents one worksheet in Microsoft Excel Workbook.

remarks.p: Excel worksheet is essentially a table with fixed and limited number of rows and columns. Internally, worksheet is allocated with minimal size and is dynamically extended in width and height as requests are made. To create new worksheet, use method of .
